title.narrative: Early Recovery Respose for Tropical Cyclone Mora Affected Communities in Cox's Bazar (SI)

description.narrative: This 6-months proposed ECHO action led by Christian Aid (CA) alongside consortium partners Action Contre la Faim (ACF) and Solidarités International (SI) aims to address the emergency recovery needs of the affected communities of Category 1 Tropical Cyclone (TC) Mora in Cox’s Bazar district, South East Bangladesh. The action will focus on 5 Upazilas: 1) Chakaria, 2) Maheshkali, 3) Teknaf, 4) Kutubdia and 5) Cox’s Bazar Sadar. The proposed action will cover 20 priority unions identified by the Needs Assessment Working Group (NAWG). The proposed action will support the most vulnerable people residing in remote areas, reaching 7250 households with assistance in the form of conditional and unconditional Multi-Purpose Cash Grants (MPCG) and WASH interventions. The project is intended to address their immediate needs such as shelter, food security, and livelihood to restore access to life preserving services and to meet basic needs for resilient survival during the transitional period of recovery. The project also aims to provide access to safe WASH facilities to the most vulnerable communities at risk of outbreak of water-borne diseases and aims to make safe 188 water points and 280 latrines

This action is a continuation of the consortium members’ response interventions funded by Start Fund and agencies’ own resources. Protection, Gender and Age diversity and Inclusion principles are integrated throughout this action. The Consortium will work in close coordination with clusters, cash working group and other humanitarian actors including UN agencies, Red Cross, INGO Sub-committee and other local CSOs to avoid duplication and complement the recovery efforts.
